001package intermediate;
002
003import com.sandwich.koan.Koan;
004
005import java.text.DateFormat;
006import java.util.Calendar;
007import java.util.Date;
008import java.util.Locale;
009
010import static com.sandwich.koan.constant.KoanConstants.__;
011import static com.sandwich.util.Assert.assertEquals;
012
013public class AboutLocale {
014
015    @Koan
016    public void localizedOutputOfDates() {
017        Calendar cal = Calendar.getInstance();
018        cal.set(2011, 3, 3);
019        Date date = cal.getTime();
020        Locale localeBR = new Locale("pt", "BR"); // portuguese, Brazil
021        DateFormat dateformatBR = DateFormat.getDateInstance(DateFormat.FULL, localeBR);
022        assertEquals(dateformatBR.format(date), __);
023
024        Locale localeJA = new Locale("de"); // German
025        DateFormat dateformatJA = DateFormat.getDateInstance(DateFormat.FULL, localeJA);
026        // Well if you don't know how to type these characters, try "de", "it" or "us" ;-)
027        assertEquals(dateformatJA.format(date), __);
028    }
029
030    @Koan
031    public void getCountryInformation() {
032        Locale locBR = new Locale("pt", "BR");
033        assertEquals(locBR.getDisplayCountry(), __);
034        assertEquals(locBR.getDisplayCountry(locBR), __);
035
036        Locale locCH = new Locale("it", "CH");
037        assertEquals(locCH.getDisplayCountry(), __);
038        assertEquals(locCH.getDisplayCountry(locCH), __);
039        assertEquals(locCH.getDisplayCountry(new Locale("de", "CH")), __);
040    }
041
042}
